item.title: Warren Buffett, warning of ‘scoundrels’ and ‘fiscal folly,’ slashes his exposure to U.S. stocks
item.description: Instead, the “Oracle of Omaha” has become a “committed” and “long-term” investor in a handful of Japanese companies.

item.title: ‘I’ve opened a hornet’s nest’: My mother-in-law lists my husband as beneficiary on her $1 million IRA. But her will says otherwise. Which wins?
item.description: “All of this is causing a lot of turmoil in the family. Does her will trump the IRA beneficiary?”

item.title: Warren Buffett amasses more cash and sells more stock, but doesn't explain why in annual letter
item.description: "The great majority of your money remains in equities," Buffett wrote in his highly-anticipated annual letter. "That preference won't change."
